class.name: OScriptNodeLocalVariable
class.brief_description: Provides a variable for storing a temporary value.
class.description: The [OScriptNodeLocalVariable] node is used for storing a value in a temporary variable location, equivalent to the following: [codeblock] func _process(delta:float): var local_variable = 25 [/codeblock] The [OScriptNodeLocalVariable] nodes can only be added to user-defined functions in an orchestration. They are used to store a temporary reference to a value while the function executes. The output pin returns the current value assigned to the local variable. To assign a value to the local variable, use an [OScriptNodeAssignLocalVariable] node.
